Please try again, this conflicted with #15555

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10717584816/job/29717574734)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10717584816/job/29717575341)

We often use `apply` instead of `toFun` in names

Does it make sense to have several versions of this statement?
E.g.
```
j - i ≤ p j - p i     -- what the docstring says
p i + j ≤ p j + i     -- avoids Nat subtraction
```
Changed the lemma to your variant. I only need it for `head_add_length_le_int` anyways, and for other users probably the subtraction-avoiding variant suffices, thanks to the power of `omega`.
